com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport

Interface EncryptDecryptHelpers


  • public interface EncryptDecryptHelpers
    With some ConnectionTypes, a key is exchanged upon successful connection establishment. This key allows for weak encryption and decryption of Buffer content, where the user determines which buffers or portions of buffers to encrypt/decrypt.

    If no key was exchanged or the connection type does not support key exchange, the encryption and decryption methods will return failure.

    A single EncryptDecryptHelpers object can be used to encrypt or decrypt buffers across multiple Channel objects, as each Channel tracks it's own encryption key.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateEncryptedSize

        long calculateEncryptedSize(Buffer unencryptedInput)
        Calculates the number of byte needed to encrypt the passed in content.
        Parameters:
        unencryptedInput - the Buffer to determine encryption length for.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes needed to encrypt the passed in Buffer

      • calculateEncryptedSize

        long calculateEncryptedSize(TransportBuffer unencryptedInput)
        Calculates the number of byte needed to encrypt the passed in content.
        Parameters:
        unencryptedInput - the TransportBuffer to determine encryption length for.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes needed to encrypt the passed in TransportBuffer

      • encryptBuffer

        int encryptBuffer(Channel channel,
                  Buffer bufferToEncrypt,
                  Buffer encryptedOutput,
                  Error error)
        Performs weak encryption on the buffer contents
        Parameters:
        channel - the Channel the content should be encrypted for
        bufferToEncrypt - the Buffer housing the contents to encrypt.
        encryptedOutput - the Buffer to encrypt into. This must have enough capacity for encryption. See calculateEncryptedSize()
        error - the Error, populated in cases where failure occurs
        Returns:
        TransportReturnCodes and CodecReturnCodes

      • decryptBuffer

        int decryptBuffer(Channel channel,
                  Buffer bufferToDecrypt,
                  Buffer decryptedOutput,
                  Error error)
        Decrypts by reversing weak encryption on buffer contents
        Parameters:
        channel - the Channel the content should be decrypted from
        bufferToDecrypt - the Buffer housing the contents to decrypt.
        decryptedOutput - the Buffer to decrypt into. This must have enough capacity for encryption. Should contain at least bufferToDecrypt.length() bytes.
        error - the Error, populated in cases where failure occurs
        Returns:
        TransportReturnCodes and CodecReturnCodes

      • encryptBuffer
